body_html:
Could I ask you to open a separate bug about the "paths with spaces" issue? That doesn't necessarily seem like a Mac-specific problem, and might be something that we should be handling at a different level.

Then we could focus the issue down to the "invisible files" problem on OSX.
The thread at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/284115/cross-platform-hidden-file-detection suggests that just detecting the leading "." might suffice for ignoring the usual hidden files on Mac and UNIX. That would seem to cover the .DS_Store case.

body:
Could I ask you to open a separate bug about the "paths with spaces" issue? That doesn't necessarily seem like a Mac-specific problem, and might be something that we should be handling at a different level. 

Then we could focus the issue down to the "invisible files" problem on OSX. 
The thread at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/284115/cross-platform-hidden-file-detection suggests that just detecting the leading "." might suffice for ignoring the usual hidden files on Mac and UNIX. That would seem to cover the .DS_Store case.
